meanings.definition: To sweeten or make more palatable.
meanings.sent1: I always edulcorate my coffee with a little bit of sugar.
meanings.sent2: She decided to edulcorate the bitter medicine with honey.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to edulcorate the spicy dish, but ended up making it too sweet.
meanings.sent4: Her smile edulcorated the room, making everyone feel at ease.
meanings.sent5: The music edulcorated the atmosphere, creating a sense of tranquility.

meanings.definition: To make less harsh or severe.
meanings.sent1: The teacher always edulcorates her feedback to be encouraging.
meanings.sent2: He tried to edulcorate the punishment by reducing the detention time.
meanings.sent3: The comedian edulcorated the embarrassing situation with a joke.
meanings.sent4: His apology edulcorated the tension in the room, making everyone relax.
meanings.sent5: The rain edulcorated the scorching heat, bringing relief to the town.
